page.title: 06RETIRE CHAPEL
page.content: The chapel is situated in the small hamlet of Retire. It is a Wesleyan chapel built in{1889}as a response to the needs of local miners from the quarries. Local stone was used including stone from Grogley and Lime Pits.Many volunteers helped to build the chapel which holds about 100 people. Local people from Lanivet contributed to the Â£1000 needed to build and furnish the chapel. Services are still held most weeks but the congregation is very small and the upkeep of the chapel is hard to maintain.
